page.title: 09ST.MARY'S CHURCH,ROWNER.
page.content: The church of{St.Mary the Virgin Rowner has a long and illustrious history.There has been a church on this site since{1054}, which is mentioned in the original{Domesday {Book.}The present church consists of a small{13th. century building}and a new extension which was consecrated in {1966.}This was built to serve the new Naval estate and private housing development in the Rowner war.Prior to the 1960's the old church served a predominantly rural area on the fringe of Gosport.The character of the area changed dramatically from rural to urban,thus the need for the extension. About 16 regular services are held each week,supplemented by about 50 weddings,120 Christenings and 90 funerals in an average year.Groups using the church include Cubs,Guides, Brownies,Mothers Union & youth groups.
